name: Caesar Salad
description: A classic salad made with crisp Romaine lettuce, tangy Caesar dressing, crunchy croutons, and grated Parmesan cheese. Grilled chicken can be added for extra flavor and protein.
instructions: Wash and dry the lettuce.
Toss the lettuce with Caesar dressing.
Add croutons and Parmesan cheese.
Top with grilled chicken (optional).

name: Greek Salad
description: A refreshing salad with crisp Romaine lettuce, juicy tomatoes, crunchy cucumber, tangy red onion, creamy Feta cheese, and briny Kalamata olives, dressed with olive oil and lemon juice.
instructions: Wash and chop the lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion.
Combine in a large bowl.
Add feta cheese and Kalamata olives.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Margherita Pizza
description: A classic Italian pizza topped with tangy tomato sauce, gooey mozzarella cheese, and fragrant fresh basil, drizzled with olive oil and seasoned with salt and pepper.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Top with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.

name: Pepperoni Pizza
description: A classic favorite featuring tomato sauce, melted mozzarella cheese, and savory pepperoni slices on a crispy crust, seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Top with mozzarella cheese and pepperoni.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.

name: California Roll
description: A popular sushi roll filled with sushi rice, nori, imitation crab, creamy avocado, and crisp cucumber, garnished with sesame seeds and served with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
instructions: Cook sushi rice according to package instructions.
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori.
Arrange imitation crab, avocado, and cucumber in a horizontal line on the rice.
Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat.
Slice the sushi roll into bite-sized pieces.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

name: Tuna Roll
description: A delicious sushi roll made with sushi rice, nori, fresh raw tuna, and garnished with sesame seeds. Served with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger for dipping.
instructions: Cook sushi rice according to package instructions.
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori.
Arrange raw tuna in a horizontal line on the rice.
Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat.
Slice the sushi roll into bite-sized pieces.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

name: Soft Shell Tacos
description: Delicious tacos made with soft tortillas, seasoned ground beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa. Perfect for a quick and easy meal.
instructions: Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium heat.
Add taco seasoning and cook according to package instructions.
Warm soft shell tacos in the oven or microwave.
Fill each taco with seasoned ground beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, and shredded cheese.
Top with sour cream and salsa.

name: Hard Shell Tacos
description: Crunchy tacos filled with seasoned ground beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa, served in a crispy hard shell. A family favorite!
instructions: Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium heat.
Add taco seasoning and cook according to package instructions.
Warm hard shell tacos in the oven or microwave.
Fill each taco with seasoned ground beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, and shredded cheese.
Top with sour cream and salsa.

name: Chicken Alfredo
description: A comforting pasta dish made with tender fettuccine noodles, juicy chicken breast, creamy Alfredo sauce, and a sprinkle of parsley. A classic Italian favorite!
instructions: Cook fettuccine noodles according to package instructions.
Season chicken breast with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Cook chicken breast in a skillet over medium heat until cooked through.
Add Alfredo sauce to the skillet and stir until heated through.
Serve chicken Alfredo over cooked fettuccine noodles.
Garnish with parsley.

name: Chicken Parmesan
description: A classic Italian-American dish featuring breaded chicken breast smothered in marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese, served with a side of spaghetti or your favorite pasta.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Season chicken breast with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Dip chicken breast in a mixture of breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Place chicken breast in a baking dish and top with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and cheese is melted.
Garnish with parsley.

name: Chicken Adobo
description: A Filipino dish made with chicken simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and various spices until tender and flavorful.
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add chicken pieces to the pot and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until chicken is tender, about 30-40 minutes.
Heat oil in a separate pan and fry the chicken pieces until browned and crispy, if desired.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Pork Adobo
description: A classic Filipino dish featuring pork simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices until tender and flavorful.
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add pork pieces to the pot and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until pork is tender, about 1 hour or more depending on the cut.
Heat oil in a separate pan and fry the pork pieces until browned and crispy, if desired.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Beef Adobo
description: A hearty Filipino dish made with beef simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices until tender and flavorful.
ingredients: Beef stew meat (such as chuck or brisket)
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add beef pieces to the pot and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until beef is tender, about 1.5 to 2 hours.
Heat oil in a separate pan and fry the beef pieces until browned and caramelized, if desired.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Egg Adobo
description: A variation of Filipino adobo made with hard-boiled eggs simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices, absorbing the rich flavors of the sauce.
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add hard-boiled eggs to the pot and simmer over low heat for about 15-20 minutes, allowing the eggs to absorb the flavors of the sauce.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Squid Adobo
description: A seafood twist on Filipino adobo featuring tender squid simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices until savory and tender.
instructions: Clean the squid thoroughly, removing the head, skin, and ink sac.
In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add the cleaned squid to the pot and simmer over low heat for about 20-30 minutes, until the squid is tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Fish Adobo
description: A Filipino dish made with fish fillets (such as tilapia or mackerel) simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices until tender and flavorful.
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add fish fillets to the pot and simmer over low heat for about 15-20 minutes, until the fish is cooked through and tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Frog Adobo
description: A unique dish from the Philippines featuring frog legs simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices until tender and flavorful.
instructions: Clean the frog legs thoroughly.
In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add the cleaned frog legs to the pot and simmer over low heat for about 30-40 minutes, until the meat is tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Goat Adobo
description: A flavorful Filipino dish made with goat meat simmered in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices until tender and savory.
ingredients: Goat meat (such as shoulder or leg)
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and water.
Add goat meat to the pot and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until goat meat is tender, about 2-3 hours depending on the cut.
Heat oil in a separate pan and fry the goat meat until browned, if desired.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Pork Sisig
description: A popular Filipino dish made with chopped pork belly, seasoned with calamansi (or lime), soy sauce, vinegar, and chili peppers, usually served on a sizzling plate.
instructions: Boil pork belly until tender, then grill or broil until crispy.
Chop the grilled pork belly into small pieces.
In a pan, sauté garlic, onions, and chili peppers.
Add chopped pork belly, soy sauce, vinegar, and calamansi or lime juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Optional: Top with mayonnaise and/or a raw egg before serving.
Serve hot on a sizzling plate.

name: Pancit
description: A Filipino noodle dish typically made with bihon (rice noodles) or canton (egg noodles), mixed with vegetables, meat (such as chicken, pork, or shrimp), and flavored with soy sauce and citrus.
instructions: Soak bihon or canton noodles in water until soft, then drain and set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add chicken, pork, or shrimp and cook until meat is browned and cooked through.
Add vegetables and cook until tender-crisp.
Pour chicken broth or water into the pan and bring to a boil.
Add noodles and cook until liquid is absorbed and noodles are tender.
Season with soy sauce, calamansi or lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve hot as a main dish or side.

name: Ginisang Munggo
description: A Filipino dish made with mung beans (monggo), sautéed with garlic, onions, tomatoes, and various vegetables, often flavored with pork or shrimp.
instructions: Boil mung beans in water until soft, then drain and set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic, onions, and tomatoes until fragrant and softened.
Add pork belly or shrimp and cook until browned and cooked through.
Add boiled mung beans and mix well.
Add spinach or bitter melon leaves (ampalaya) and cook until wilted.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Beef Pares
description: A Filipino comfort food dish consisting of beef stewed in soy sauce, star anise, and garlic until tender, served with garlic fried rice (sinangag) and a bowl of beef broth.
instructions: In a pot, sauté garlic in oil until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned on all sides.
Add soy sauce, star anise, brown sugar, and enough beef broth to cover the meat.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until beef is tender, about 2-3 hours.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with garlic fried rice (sinangag) and a bowl of beef broth.

name: Daing
description: A Filipino dish of salted and dried fish, typically marinated in vinegar and garlic, then fried until crispy. It is commonly served with steamed rice and tomatoes.
ingredients: Dried fish (such as danggit, dilis, or tuyo)
instructions: If using dried fish that needs to be softened, soak it in water for about 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Marinate the dried fish in vinegar and minced garlic for at least 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Fry the marinated dried fish until crispy and golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with steamed rice and sliced tomatoes.

name: Jollibee Fried Chicken
description: Famous Filipino-style fried chicken known for its crispy skin and juicy meat, usually served with steamed rice and a side of gravy or a sweet and spicy sauce.
instructions: If using buttermilk, marinate chicken pieces in buttermilk, salt, and pepper for at least 1 hour (optional).
In a bowl, mix salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and cornstarch.
Coat each chicken piece thoroughly with the seasoning mixture.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Fry chicken pieces in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 12-15 minutes per batch.
Transfer fried chicken to a wire rack or paper towels to drain excess oil.
Serve hot with steamed rice and your choice of gravy or sauce.

name: Bagoong
description: A Filipino condiment made from fermented fish or shrimp, commonly used to add a salty and savory flavor to various dishes such as vegetables, stews, and sauces.
instructions: If using fermented fish or shrimp that is too salty, soak it in water for a few minutes, then drain.
In a bowl, mix fermented fish or shrimp with minced garlic, a pinch of sugar, and vinegar (if desired) to balance the flavors.
Serve as a condiment alongside dishes like green mangoes, tomatoes, or as a flavoring agent in stews and sauces.
